intro: Clutia thunbergii var. vaccinioides, commonly known as the red-flowered clutia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, opposite, ovate leaves that are usually glossy and dark green. The plant produces clusters of small, pink to reddish flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia, including parts of India and Southeast Asia. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks.
